The '''North-way''' was the name of a road in the [[Pelennor Fields]] in [[Gondor]].

==Course==
The North-way ran from the gate of [[Minas Tirith]] to the [[Forannest|north gate]] of the [[Rammas Echor]] where it joined the [[Great West Road]].<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''North-way'', p. 635</ref><ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''north gate'', p. 559</ref>

==History==
On 5 May, {{TA|3019}} when [[Éomer]] and [[Éowyn]]<ref>{{App|Chief}}, entry for the year 3019, ''May'', 8., p. 1095</ref> rode back from Minas Tirith with the [[Rohirrim]] and [[Elladan]] and [[Elrohir]] on the North-way, the road was lined with people who praised them from the gate of Minas Tirith to the Rammas Echor.<ref>{{RK|Steward}}, p. 969</ref> On the evening of Mid-year's day [[Elrond]] with his daugther [[Arwen]] and his sons Elladan and Elrohir and all the household from [[Rivendell]] and [[Galadriel]] and [[Celeborn]] with many folk from [[Lothlórien]] used the North-way to come to the gate of Minas Tirith for the wedding of Arwen with the recently crowned King [[Aragorn]].<ref>{{RK|Steward}}, p. 972</ref><ref>{{App|Chief}}, entry for the year 3019, ''1 Lithe'', p. 1095</ref>
 
==Other versions of the legendarium==
The North-way is called the '''North Road''' on an unnamed map of the surroundings of Minas Tirith that was drawn by J.R.R. Tolkien during the writing of [[The Lord of the Rings]], which is electronically labelled MINAS TIRITH on the website of the Tolkien Estate<ref name=MinasTirithMap>{{webcite|author=[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]|articleurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20190515184844/https://www.tolkienestate.com/assets/images/megamaps/minas-tirith-plan.jpg|articlename=Unnamed map of the surroundings of Minas Tirith|dated=|website=|accessed=21 June 2021}}</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2015: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:A road runs from the [[Forannest|North-Gate]] of [[Rammas Echor]] to the [[Great Gates]] of [[Minas Tirith]] but is not identified by name.
